授業目的: This course focuses on cross-national comparisons of social welfare policies and social development theories and policies. Students examine the above areas through in-depth analyses of selected countries’ policies and social development strategies.
到達目標:
After successfully completing the course, students will be able to:
1. Demonstrate understanding of the differences among countries in how social welfare policies are organized and their various strengths and limitations.
2. Demonstrate understanding of economic, political, and cultural factors that shape the social policies of countries.
3. Identify various theories, policies, and strategies for social development and be able to critique them in relation to their impacts on people's welfare.
特記事項: 本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法: Lectures followed by group discussions and groupwork.

第2回:

Lecture followed by group discussion
第4回:

Lecture followed by group discussion on poverty
第5回:
Global Immigration and multiculturalism
Lecture followed by group discussion on migration
第6回:
Globalization of Care: Foreign domestic workers in Hong Kong
Lecture followed by group discussion
第7回:
What is welfare state?
Lecture on Swedish (Nordic) model of welfare state followed by group discussion
第8回:
International Social welfare and SDGs
Preparation for mid-term presentation
第9回:
Australian model of welfare states
Lecture followed by group discussion on Middle class welfare state
第10回:
Japanese model of welfare state
Lecture followed by group discussion on Middle class welfare state
第13回:
Multicultural social work/ Social Enterprise in the era of globalization
Lecture followed by group discussion
第14回:
Conclusions: Realizing Global Citizenship
Submission of Final Report
